Reviews.Title: “Can't Recommend”
Reviews.Author: SantaRosaCAKim
Reviews.Content: As a last minute get-away there was availability. When told there was only one room had thought it must be pretty popular. Ummmmm no. One of the few rooms that weren't undergoing renovations. Very thin walls. Quite possible the folks next door were permanent residents. This place has a long way to go to be brought up to current standards. Pools, restaurant closed. Look out the back windows to weeds and another wing where the windows are simply being plastered over. The complimentary coffee was really good. If they ever bring the rest of the property up to the condition of the lobby they may be onto something.

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Village Inn and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: Beware, this hotel is not one thinks of when one thinks of an Inn. Don't know about the Spa as we did not use spa services or even see the spa. The best I can say is the bathroom and bedding were clean. I guess the "Inn" is having the roof repaired because it was covered with blue tarp in several places. We just hoped it wouldn't rain that night (luckily it didn't). Our room has not been updated or modernized since the 60s I bet. Floor under the rug was uneven. We ended up at this "Inn" after we tried to book a room for one night at the Best Western in Calistoga. BW was full and they recommended the Calistoga Village Inn and Spa as a hotel where they send overflow. They even transferred our call there. Booked the room sight unseeen. If the Best Western recommended them, they must be OK. Check-in was smooth. We drove around the back to our room. The room only cost $75 plus tax so I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “2 Strikes but Stayin Alive”
Reviews.Author: longhornwine
Reviews.Content: Had some problems with the res before arrival, and manager was pretty crass, but it worked out. The property is under renovation, and all the mineral spas are closed. This is basically a motel that is old, and shows it. Your first impression would be to turn around and run! But wait. The rooms are very clean, and you can get a hot tub in some of them. The rooms are big, the showers are miniscule. The bed is comfortable, and there's a mini fridge and coffee maker. The value shows up in the location! It's right on the Silverado Trail, so real plus for being up-valley. They have a goofy little plastic chair outside the room, but it works, and sitting in the beautiful Napa morning with a cup of coffee is priceless. It's fairly quiet, as you're almost in the country. You can drive into Calistoga for food or supplies.....about 1/2 mile. And the price is the lowest around, so if you want to spend your money on wine, and you're only going to be in your room to sleep, you won't be disappointed. Just be sure you don't have to worry about impressing anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up manager”
Reviews.Author: Rarodog
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay because all the manager had was a small double room left and looked a me (6'2") and partner (5'11") but very kindly called around and found us a room at Hillcrest Motel which we loved. Not sure if this is an eligable review but for service the manager get 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that great.”
Reviews.Author: ron w
Reviews.Content: It would have been helpful for me to decide if I would have known that they were remodeling many of their units. They have policies about noise and people staying there to rest and relax and it is hard to do so when you construction workers hammering anf such. Plus the fact the rooms are pretty close to the road and one can hear the cars zipping by, hard to sleep with the noise. The beds are not all that comfortable, the heating system is in a closet type room and didn't heat the entire room and the door's weather stripping was peeling off allowing cool air to seep in. The pool area was not all that great either, as the hot tub's water was barely luke warm and should be warmer. I did get a decent rate and now I understand why. I think they should be up front on their website so a person can decide whether or not the inn is where they would like to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, pool, and grounds”
Reviews.Author: Luba B
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is older and is being fixed a little here and there, the staff, pool and grounds are wonderful. I have been coming to village inn for about fifteen year and always enjoyed staying in this hotel, and the last trip Calistoga inn with my finance Shawn was really special not only because it was our engagement celebration but also because of very warm welcome and attention from employee Cory. This young man almost a kid did his best to make us comfortable and helped us enjoy our time in Napa. He was very friendly, warm, and caring. We would highly recommend to everybody to come to this hotel and enjoy not only the facilities of the beautiful back yard and pools but also the warms of this young nice man, Cory. Luba Brezhnev

Reviews.Title: “desk manager lies about conditions”
Reviews.Author: Carmen L
Reviews.Content: Called Village Inn two hours before leaving to ensure there were tub rooms available at off season price and that all pools were running at correct temps. We were very specific and the desk fellow (middle aged soft spoken) assured us that all was well. On arrival we discover that the jacuzzi in our "tub room" has been nailed shut with plywood and the desk guy says there are no others available. So we went to check on the three therapy pools - all were less than tepid. These are big pools that are always run specific temperatures. We cancelled out and went to Roman Spa -- a very nice place. It's hard to figure how this desk guy benefits anyone by lying but that's what he does.

Reviews.Title: “not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: burli993
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website is nothing like what the actual place looks like. No heat, not enough towels very very very basic. Worse than what you could think of. Holes in the curtains, not enough places to put your luggage, not enough electrical outlets, the shower stall is very very very small, takes a while for the hot water to become hot. We had come from another state for a family function so I will never ever go back there and I will not recommend it to my family members that do go there all the time. I also asked if they could do anything about the price since we didn't have any heat and I was told "no because I had placed the reservations on line". I believe that is totally unfair. The guy behind the desk wouldn't even consider it. Very Rude!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER, EVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honestly373
Reviews.Content: My mom and family have been going to the Village Inn since I was about 5 (I just turned 32), and had continued to go out not only because the cost was cheap for the area, but also out of loyalty and nostalgia. We stayed about a few times a year even after the decline in the quality of their amenities (ie: hot tub or sauna not working, loss of decent masseuses, empty promises to refurbish rooms year after year, etc). But I will absolutely NEVER go again after the way I was treated by their "manager" this past weekend. I had reserved a room about 1 month ago since I knew it could be a busy weekend. I knew that I was running late for check-in and when I called to do a verbal check-in, the guy I was talking to, who ended up being the "manager", said that my card had been declined. I know that I had money on either of the 2 cards I could had given them, so my only thought was that they could have taken down the incorrect number. As I was trying to give the correct card number to him, he constantly interrupted me, saying "that wasn't the card # you gave me." He literally would not allow me to finish. I was honestly surprised at how well I composed myself despite my frustration, considering how rudely he was treating me by not allowing me to finish, or even waiting to see if perhaps they had been the ones to make the mistake. They never even contacted me to tell me the card had been declined! I bit my tongue and called him "sir" (although in my mind I was calling him a whole host of other things), and kept asking him to allow me to finish. Around the time he brought me to tears by flat out saying he wouldn't allow me to finish and wouldn't give me the room I had booked a month ago for my birthday celebration, my bf took over the conversation. He too was shocked at this man's utter disrespect and lack of customer service. Don't waste your time or money there. It honestly isn't worth the crappy room, even for wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Always a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzard68
Reviews.Content: The best deal in the Napa valley! Always clean, very hospitable staff, and convenient. The two rooms are the best for families or two colleagues traveling together on business. Pool and spa are a bonus. Been there forever, so don't expect the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Gets a bad rap”
Reviews.Author: TravelistaCA
Reviews.Content: This place gets a bad rap on this site. It's really a matter of expectations. For the price, I am surprised people expect a more deluxe place to stay. My room was quiet, clean and had all the basics....comfy bed, working television, hot shower. I didn't use the pool but had a look at it. People were usiing it and it didn't look dirty. The spa isn't much, really just some treatment rooms but I did get a good massage. If you want an affordable but decent place in Calistoga, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expect for $120!”
Reviews.Author: Hbolli
Reviews.Content: I'm really not sure why this area in general thinks they can charge what they do for what they deliver. I live in San Francisco and would have gotten a much nicer room here for my $120. The windows are all painted and/or screwed shut (much trouble with theft??) which is a shame in a place where the weather really is nice. The outside looks like any standard drive up old run down motel - that would would pay $59 a night for. The sink leaked so there was a nice puddle on the countertop. The see-through towels were so small I actually used two, one to cover my armpits to waist and another to cover my waist and thighs. We had to call the management at 2am to get them to shut down the party the neighbors were having out front. All in all we turned up our sense of humors and down our expectations and just tried to get some sleep. Napa county in general has a lot to learn. There are many places in CA to taste great wine. Eldorado, Amador, Mendocino and SLO county just to name a few. In all these places you will receive much more for your money and pay much less in pretension.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: gregoryLima
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay there for one night over July weekend with my family because we were planning to stay just one night, This place was the only one that took our reservation. Later we decided maybe to arrive a day early, contacted them and they said were full. We had to stay around American Canyon. When we arrive, they said we had a two night reservation and got a charge for no show plus the night in a sort of RV room. This place should be out of business. We like mineral waters but the pools are sub par

Reviews.Title: “Take the kids, not the fiancee.”
Reviews.Author: andoor
Reviews.Content: this place is great if you're traveling with kids. the pools and vibe is very kid-friendly. for adults, not so much. the rooms are fairly run-down; bathrooms are functional-barely; walls are paper-thin. we had a normal family next door, but it sounded like they were in our room. staff was super-friendly. If you book a room, ask for a room in the back, NOT in the front, facing the highway. The spa services and spa therapist was first rate, and spa treatment prices are reasonable. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “No frills guarantees more money for wine!”
Reviews.Author: scubasiren54
Reviews.Content: This clean, old hotel is almost embarassing but if you are Ok with it as a place to sleep allowing you to spend more on great wine and great cusinine yu won;t be disappointed. Linoleum floors in bathrioiom buyt clean, lumoy bed but quiet. Large sitting area and good TV makes this plabe just fine.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Julio_Cesar_Diaz
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent hotel that provides good service and has a lovely staff. Without doubts, a comfortable place to rest and spend pleasant vacations. I felt really happy during my stay because I had access to internet without problems, I enjoyed the swimming pool which has the perfect temperature and my room every day was clean. Also, the lobby hotel is really quiet. The manager, assistant manager and maintenance worker are excellent professionals. I hope to return this place.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you really need to save money, avoid this place.”
Reviews.Author: hapacouple
Reviews.Content: Our friends who lived in wine country (but haven't lived there for 7 years now) recommended this place...our guess is it was a nice little out of the way place years ago, but it's pretty run down now. It sounded great...jacuzzi in the room, mineral pool out back. Well, upon arrival, the lady who checked us in was nice, but after we got to our room which was a drive all the way to the back of the motel, we discovered the in-room jacuzzi was boarded up, the toilet was leaking and the heater didn't work. We were there in December 2009 and it was in the 30's in the evening, so the heater was a must. The furniture was older, the bed not so comfortable, but the room was fairly large for the price. After finding the leaky toilet, we decided to ask for another room. The front desk lady was nice about it. The new room was smaller, but closer to the mineral pool. We rushed off to the Christmas Tractor Parade without checking the heater (we did make sure the toilet wasn't leaking). Once we got back we discovered the heater barely worked. We had it on high and the only way you could feel warm air was to be standing by it with your hands on it. We decided to make the best of our stay and I talked my boyfriend into trying the mineral pool expecting a hot pool of water...after all, that's what the motel is known for! Well, it was luke warm and it was pretty late, so we tried everything we could to make the water warmer...no luck. The bed in our new room felt cheap and so were the covers. The heater was outside of the bedroom near the bathroom...so we were very cold that night. Perhaps during the summer, this place wouldn't seem so bad? But as mentioned, only if you really need to save money. Parking is free and plentiful. The town is definitely pretty and quaint though.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable if you can overlook flaws”
Reviews.Author: dwheatl
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting this inn for many years. We enjoy the mineral pools, and the Calistoga area is unbelievably beautiful in the fall. We love that we could get a two-room suite for less than $100 a night. However, there are a few flaws that might be deal breakers for some guests. The swimming pool was not warm at all this visit. The sides of the wading pool are discolored from the minerals, and there is even some moss growing in it. The area around the pools is covered with tiny stones that come loose and stick to your feet. Because the pools are heated by natural hot springs, the temperatures fluctuate. With that said, there was always at least one pool that was comfortably warm in November. When we talked to the person at the front desk about the hot tub not being hot, he even had the maintenance man come by on his day off to set it right. The coffee, tea, and cocoa in the morning are all good, and we just brought some instant oatmeal to have a light breakfast so we could enjoy the pools before heading into town for shopping and more substantial food.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but lowest prices in town”
Reviews.Author: junga11
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night at this hotel. It was the cheapest hotel in the area so that is why we chose it. Compared to others we have stayed previously, this one is not so nice. Its very outdated and we got that 'not so clean' feeling. There were ants crawling on the vanity which isn't surprising since the weather strip on the door was missing. We had to keep a towel in front of the door so our room wouldn't be cold overnight. But, I guess for the money we saved compared to other hotels, this should have all been expected.

Reviews.Title: “cheap-no concept of customer service”
Reviews.Author: karenjoym
Reviews.Content: Clean and cheap rooms, ugly view to parking lot. Pools were OK, however YOU ARE KICKED OUT EVERY DAY AT 11 AM " for cleaning". When we returned at 1 pm the pool was still filled with leaves. The management explained that the closure was to stop people from checking out and then using the facility, but we were the only people there and were still kicked out! Sauna was broken. Shower in room was also malfunctioning. Management seemed unconcerned with any concept of customer service. Pools close promptly at 10 pm. If you are interested in a relaxing spa experience- this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Going to be remodeled eventually but not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: calady50
Reviews.Content: I thought I was booking into Indian Springs so it was quite a shock at first. However, this place was a lot less money and tho it has closed it's spa, the pools made up for it. The pool area is like being in a park with trees and lots of sun or shade and very peaceful. (Tho there will be lots of leaves in the pools and they won't let you use them before checking in or after:( The jacuzzi's under cover (which is great when it gets warm there), however the sauna no longer works. There is a soaking mineral pool also that the kids love as it's shallow. If you were bringing your kids who love to swim, I'd say this was a good place as more towards the outskirts of town so quieter. You can also walk to alittle restaurant across the street tho it's alittle trek to the main part of town but walkable. The bed was comfortable tho the room reminds me of from the 50's. I liked how the air conditioner is NOT right by the bed but in this big as a walkin closet without the doors area by the bathroom. The bathroom is tiny tho, with only a shower. They really should replace the rusty toilet paper holder while they are awaiting the economy to recover for their "remodel". It looks like a 50's motel from the outside too. The staff was very nice and informative. If you are looking for just a place to sleep and swim for less money, this will do but dont expect fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value; no luxury; employees need customer service training”
Reviews.Author: Wilmettetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in August with my two grown daughters. We were visiting and sight seeing and did not want an expensive place. August is peak travel time to the wineries and the hotel prices, even at budget type hotels like Clarion, were quite high.I have stayed with my husband at some of the very lovely resorts, including the Harvest Inn in St. Helena. On a prior trip, I had visited the property so I knew what I was going to get and I thought the pools were quite nice. Our room (which had two rooms - one with a queen bed and a second room with a double and single bed, was fine. Nothing luxurious, but clean, sunny and reasonably furnished. For $110 per night, it was a great bargain. My concerns were that the sliding door to the outside of the second bedroom was broken and could not be locked, which raised security concerns for my two daughters and the front desk person simply said "It's broken." Also, the closure of the pools right in the middle of the day was annoying and the young man who supposedly was cleaning was quite rude to the point of actually being scary. I told the manager, who commented that he was surprised to hear this. This young man's customer service were lacking to say the least. The pool furniture is a joke; most of it is broken, so something needs to be done. This place has potential, and it was actually full when we were there, so there is demand for lower priced accommodations. And it's conveniently located. The management needs to get on top of the problems. All in all, not bad, but certainly not a place I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury: No. Good value: Yes”
Reviews.Author: shapirosco
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Calistoga and want to stay at an Inn that has fancy rooms, spa, food, mints on the pillows, and luxury at every turn, this is not the place to go. But, if you want a basic and reliable hotel from which to visit the region, and a chance to sit in a mineral pool, enjoy the hot tub, and not pay through the nose, I recommend the Calistoga Village Inn. My wife and I first priced out a room at the Mount View Inn and Spa four blocks down the road. The cost was $250 a night, and you needed to stay two nights on weekends. That was simply out of the question for us. We instead found and stayed at the Village Inn where our total cost for one night was under $100. We then walked down the street and used the Mount View Inn for spa services. The Village Inn was basic, but clean. The towels were small, but plentiful. The manager was nice enough, and allowed us to check in early. When we asked to store our wine in the office fridge, the response was "no problem." The Village Inn provided coffee and herbal teas in the morning and a good night sleep on a good bed with four pillows and extra blankets. The bathroom had soap, shampoo, and conditioner. The room had full digital cable and a decent TV along with lamps, a chair, a dresser, a clock radio, and a hairdryer. If you are looking for a Hyatt-equivalent, walk down the street and spend $500. But if a basic hotel to use as a base for a spa visit and wine tasting is what you need, we would recomment this place.

Reviews.Title: “No concept of customer service.”
Reviews.Author: dbzad
Reviews.Content: If soaking in one of the wonderful hot springs in the area is your goal, make every effort NOT to stay here! The soaking hours are extremely limited. The sauna was broken. The hydropool had NO heat, and the two outdoor pools were filthy. The management seems more concerned with keeping the maintenence guy happy than with their guests. I am usually not a complainer, but felt that others should be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Old and funky, but a good value and very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: MarathonRunner57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of the Napa Marathon. There was a festival in downtown Calistoga that weekend too. When you pull up this place definitely looks like it needs a facelift, but our room was clean, ample and quiet. It is close enough to walk downtown but far enough way from all the noise. The hot tub and mineral pools were fine, in fact the hot tub/sauna looks to be the newest part of the whole place. A great value in an overinflated area!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, especially compared to other Napa Valley Properties”
Reviews.Author: Deedumans
Reviews.Content: Here's the good, bad and ugly on this place: The good: The pools. Somebody noted that the water isn't clear. No duh, it's mineral water so it wouldn't be. There are two pools, one cold, one about 95 and one hot tub, plus a sauna. Our daughter loved playing in the warm shallow pool and we could watch her from the hottub while she did say. The pool area was generally quite tidy and the couple of times we had a complaint (one time the hot tub was too cool, the other too hot) the management was very responsive and fixed it immediately. The rooms are good value. Ours was $75 a night and slept three of us.. We had a little fridge, micro and a sunken roman tub, which was basically a really giant (and somewhat slippery) bathtub. The staff was super helpful and very child friendly. They offered restaurant recommendations and things to do. The location is at the edge of town, which means about a .7 mile walk downtown. The Bad: Yes, it is a bit tired, probably why it isn't $200 a night like every other property in the area. It's a motel with pools, basically. The sofabed wouldn't have been comfortable for anybody over say 100 pounds...but for our 7 year old daughter was fine. One night, when we went to the tubs just around closing, there were a few loud drunk adults in the hot tub, but they weren't really obnoxious, just loud. The ugly: The furniture. It's pretty ugly. Long story short: If you are looking for a romantic hot springs getaway, this ain't it. If you are looking for good value accomodation in the Napa Valley with the addition of some quite nice pools that yes, have seen better days, then this might be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but good value”
Reviews.Author: turtlers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in November 2009. OK its tired but they upgraded us to a queen room with a couch and two person hot tub in the room in a quiet part at the back of the hotel and it was good value for a couple of nights. Ask for rooms around 165 is which are in pairs so that there is separation between you and the next room. The hot pools can be disappointing if the well is not pulling enugh heat but the staff tried really hard to keep them going and every time got them up to a good temperature. If you want to pay twice as much at least go for one of the places in town but for low end this was good value.

Reviews.Title: “at the edge of town... a hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: MMC0
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and i have been coming up to Calistoga for the last 10yrs, trying different accommodations each visit. We've done the high end (Indian Spring Resort/Solage) and the medium range (Dr. Wilkinson, the Lodge, Hideaway Cottages) but i have to say for a low end (read affordable) lodging, Calistoga Village Spa was perfect. The Staff was helpful, the room was large enough to fit the 4 of us comfortably, and the garden to 3 mineral pools was a highlight. We liked how it was at the edge of town, making it a nice morning walk to breakfast and since it sits near the Silverado Trail, we were able to enjoy wineries off the beaten path in addition to the local wildlife of deer, colorful birds and lizards. I would definitely return to this lodging and am looking forward to bringing my 11yr old, since it is also kid-friendly... always a plus for me!!

Reviews.Title: “Go for the pools and the garden - if you can deal with no frills room”
Reviews.Author: lostinthesupermarket
Reviews.Content: I was scared to stay here based upon the trip advisor reviews. But, my mom stayed here and said it wasn't bad. Now, to clarify, my mother lives in a trailer and has never stayed at a Four Seasons Hotel. I think the trip advisor reviews prepared me to lower my expectations - which is what you need to do to stay here. If you have corporate standards, don't bother. But, if you want a reasonably priced, simple place that your kids can hang out in without disturbing romantic vacationers - this will do. The real reason to stay here is the pools. There are three great hot pools - one a standard hot tub, a second "wading" type pool and a third standard size hotel pool - all of different temperatures. The pool area is shaded by lovely trees and gardens. Yes, there are sometimes leaves that float into the pool mid-day - but I'll take a few leaves if I can have some shade and the scent of flowers. The pool water is constantly circulating and it's great to not be in chlorine. There is some staining on the sides of the pools - it's not dirt - its from the minerals. There are nice tables and chaise lounge chairs. There were plenty of towels and they didn't make a big deal about giving you extra ones. The bed was comfortable. The location of the inn is right next to the silverado trail - a short bit from the town center - but you can still walk to restaurants. The road is busy and trucks tend to stop here, idle or hit their jake brakes right out front. I recommend asking for a room on the back side of the hotel to cut down noise. The place was empty when we were there - so also ask for a room without neighbors because the walls are thin. It seems like the staff is trying here. Someone really takes care of the garden. There is nice coffee, tea and cocoa in the front lobby. The staff checks the pools attentively. The cleaning staff was steam cleaning all of the carpets when we were there. Now, this did mean that they started moving furniture in the room next to ours at 7:30 am - but stopped when I asked. The price can't be beat for Calistoga. Be warned, though, that the drive to Napa is further than I thought - it took about an hour because of traffic. But we liked Calistoga - nice restaurants, beautiful scenery - and the pools were great here.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: Stormrider49
Reviews.Content: There is a reason that this is the least expensive lodging in Calistoga. Old, dirty, unfriendly, green water in the pools, no internet, holes in the sheets and towels, no insulation (listen to your neighbor snore), etc. It's worth a few dollars more to stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: jhom112
Reviews.Content: This place is aweful, we stayed here because we went to a wedding nearby. A bunch of friends stayed there as well. All I can say if that we all could not wait to get out of there. This place needs a major rennovation. The rooms have a not so pleasant smell, the decor is out dated. And the light in the rooms is terrible.This place is on a main road so all you here is outside noise every car that drives by you here.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: bookworm6308
Reviews.Content: When you look up "dump" in the dictionary, there is a picture of this place. It is moldy and dirty, and the A/C barely worked. I did end up staying because I was only in Calistoga for the night, but I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingduo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. If there had not been a big festival in town, we would not have been there the second night. I walked around barefoot in the room and discovered that the bottom of my feet were black. This Inn lacks basic things one would expect in this price range; i.e. mini-fridge, microwave, iron, etc. It was very run down. We took a photo of my feet to remind never to visit this Inn again. I've posted it--judge for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “All round good value”
Reviews.Author: bubbafatz
Reviews.Content: We all had a good stay here at this motel. It is clean and simple. Staff are friendly and helpful. Pools are great. Rooms comfortable. We had a fun mud bath and steam etc. All in all it is good value for money. It is in need of a restoration which is in the works we hear, so it is ragged around the edges, but that is reflected in the price. We went there to relax and it was laid back just the way we like it. Don't expect five star but don't be put off by other negative reviews either.

Reviews.Title: “Fall colors and hot water”
Reviews.Author: dwheatl
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Village Inn and Spa for years. What keeps us coming back? First off, the mineral pools. The swimming pool was warm enough for me to do a couple of laps in November. The wading pool was warm enough for people to sit and chat. The spa was warm enough to unkink my stiff muscles. We also love the atmosphere here. In November, the vineyards and trees change to fall colors and are a treat for the eyes. The views are lovely. We love the people here, too. The staff and clientele are all very friendly. We did a mud bath, our first, and I don't think we'll try that again. However, the spa staff also gave very good service. All in all, we had a great time. If you are looking for opulence, pass this place by, but if you are looking for a reasonably priced accomodation with great mineral pools and attentive service, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “the afffordable Easy Life”
Reviews.Author: dancerdiva
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. It is my favorite place for an affordable weekend getaway. I have had a romantic weekend here with my husband, a family vacation here with my children(5 &10 yrs) and friends, and I have visited for a Mom's/ Ladies weekend of relaxation. There is something for everyone and i've never left disappointed or anxiety ridden. The pools are just wonderful. It feels as though you have stepped back in time because the whole pool spa area has beautifully maintained gardens and landscaping. The water is warm and rejuvenating and clean. There is a large shallow pool that is just right for younger kids. It has a shelf bench all around the edge so that all can sit and enjoy the mineral water. The larger pool is really nice too. One can choose to sit on the sun deck (no shade), at a table under a wisteria covered arbor, or in a grassy spot under a huge old tree. There is a huge whirlpool inside a cabana as well. I pretty much go for the pool experience alone but I have had several different spa treatments. They were all so enjoyable and relaxing I turn into mush just thinking about it. I have had spa treatments at other spas in the Calistoga area but this one is by far my favorite. This place is not about"modern" or upscale, fancy shmancy surroundings. It is about peaceful serenity and simple relaxation. The location is great . It is not in town on the main strip, but just a little past the strip, easily within walking distance. Try to reserve a room in the back( spa entrance side) that overlooks the hills in the distance. As an artist, I love to sit and sketch in the empty field here. I really enjoy this hotel. The staff is courteous and helpful. The rooms are clean and affordable. I can just see Lucy and Ricky and Fred and Ethel staying here. I can imagine Elvis singing in the pool grotto. This place is a throw back to a simpler time. Calistoga has lots of great restaurants or if you prefer, walk down to the market and grab a picnic for poolside. Personally, I think this place is the best deal in the area.

Reviews.Title: “So Glad I Checked it Out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last week I went on the internet to find a place for my two girlfriends to celebrate one of their birthdays. (50 this year) I finally decided on the Calistoga Village Inn. I happened to be in Calistoga this last weekend and drove by to look at it. I was mortified! Its old, which didnt bother me, but it is run down and they have no business booking it as a nice place to stay. There were tarps of plastic on the roof and many of the doors stood open, possible due to a problem with the airconditioning. I walked into one of the rooms just cleaned and it looked clean but had a musty, moldy smell. I could not wait to get home and cancel the reservation. If I had not checked this out, I would have never lived this down. Tripadvisor should remove this accomodation from their listings.

Reviews.Title: “I love Village Inn and Spa its amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had spa treatments at Village Inn and Spa and they were amazing!!! I had a wonderful massage and salt scrub!!! I was completley relaxed and in heaven after ward. They had wonderful customer service and the atmosphere was beautiful. When you walk up to spa, it is surronded by a garden, several flower etc. It is amazing!!! I highly reccomend it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our relaxing weekend getaway at the Calistoga village Inn & Spa. I had been there about 1 1/2 years ago for a spa treatment and loved the somewhat dated yet clean facilites. The staff at that time was adequate but nothing more. Now that the Inn is under new management, the staff is friendly, helpful, gracious, and welcoming. They seem to truly enjoy their guests and are generous with their knowledge of the town, restaurants, and activities. This time my husband and I booked a room for two nights (using their winter special of $50 per night) and a couples' mud bath. There is no hiding the fact, when one sees the Inn, that it is on the older side and has not seen much updating. This only adds to the charm of the Village Inn experience. While the rooms are not loaded with the newest ammenities; they are basic, clean rooms with a comfortable, relaxed feel. One certainly wouldn't stay here if one is expecting something equivalent to the Ritz; but if one is looking for a clean, quiet, economical place in the heart of wine country, the Village Inn is the place to stay. Our couples mud bath experience was restful and relaxing. Imelda was very professional and ensured we were comfortable during the mud bath, mineral soak, eucalyptus steam, and blanket wrap. Jaimes and Gaye, in the office, were very friendly and accomodating. They took the time to answer our questions and make us feel at home. We will be returning next winter and would definitely recommend the Calistoga Village Inn & Spa for a relaxed, comfortable, economical place to stay in a fairly expensive part of California.

Reviews.Title: “Superior guest service and a great value in an expensive resort area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine gave me a gift certificate for the spa here, and I stayed overnight on the "Winter Special" that offered a spacious room for $50.00--unheard of in the pricey Napa Valley. The spa treatment was one of the best I've ever had, and the spa and hotel staff members were professional, efficient, and very eager to please. The spa facilities were very clean and soothing. The lodging was also very clean and comfortable. I also used all three pools and the sauna--all of which are included in the price of the room--which were immaculate and a real treat. The property is an older one and, from what the staff told me, is going to be renovated in the next few years. If you are looking for true hospitality and a relaxing getaway for a great price, this property is a wise choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and impressively relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (French Riviera native) and I (Bay Area native) stayed for a night at the Calistoga Village Inn & Spa. Sometime after all those negative reviews were written, the management has since changed as the concierge informed us. We had a great experience there, and we're going to recommend it to everyone we know. We had purchased an off-season discount pack ($30), Discover Winter in the Wine Country, from the St. Helena Chamber of Commerce. Participating merchants in the program gave discounts and reduced prices from November through March. At the Calistoga Village Inn & Spa, we got a deluxe suite (queen bed, sitting area, whirlpool) for $59, whereas such a room would normally cost up to $179 per night. It also included a small fridge, freezer, and a microwave. We enjoyed a bubble bath in the large whirlpool tub. We saved further money (as well as avoided drinking and driving) by buying food and champagne from a St. Helena deli (Dean & Delucca) to prepare and eat in our room. The discount pack also allowed us each to have a free mud bath (normally $60) with the purchase of a full-session massage ($80 for 50 minutes). We had made reservations that morning for both accommodations and spa treatments, and I was even able to reschedule the spa treatments one hour later, due to transportation issues. After two hours of driving from the city, those spa treatments washed the road stress right out of us! Right from the door, the spa staff plunged us into a relaxing atmosphere, complete with mellow music, pleasing decor, and warm smiles. The masseurs were very attentive and meticulous. Afterwards, Imelda took great care of us with the mud bath treatment, which included the mud bath itself, a shower, a mineral water bath, and eucalpytus steam. As we went from step to step, she flushed the water from each tub in preparation for any following clients. We came out of there relaxed and with super-soft skin. The next morning we went for a dip in the three mineral water pools. Of course, we made lots of jokes about the yellow tint of the pools, but the color fits with the fact that the local mineral springs are sulfurous. The chlorine did mask the scent of the sulfur, thankfully. Our whole stay there was overall positive. The only negative things that I had to say were things I could easily deal with: lack of wireless internet access, slightly crooked floor, and I had to set the clock radio myself. Nonetheless, we got a great deal on accommodations and spa treatments, and we hope to be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest people.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews we were a bit leery of staying there but our friends said enough good things about it (and the prices have to be the lowest in the valley) we thought we'd give it a shot. It's an older property, that's for sure (I'm guessing 25 years?) but it's clean enough and well-maintained. What really wowed us was the staff. James and Gaye, the owner/managers, and Jennifer who runs the spa, have been there less than a year but are just the nicest, friendliest people we've met in a long time. Thank you for making our weekend as wonderful as it was. We'll be baaack!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I have visited the Calistoga Inn & Spa on other occasions. My friend just received her Doctorate degree, so we thought we'd head up to Calistoga for some much needed rest and relaxation. We always look forward to friendliness of the staff, relaxing in the large rooms and the spa treatments. This past trip was of no exception. Gaye was the staff member who assisted us and was more than helpful in checking us in a little early. She told us of some of the restaurants close by that might strike our fancy. My Spa treatment was fantastic. Maria was the technician who performed my salt scrub and massage and it was awesome!! There was also another young lady who was very pleasant within the treatment facility. If you want to go somewhere quiet, secluded and somewhat rustic...you're gonna love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the dumpy look on the outside, the inside is much worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A few reasons to look elsewhere for your Calistoga stay: the hotel qualifies as a dump - the children's wading pool has a distinct yellow tint to the water and lacks that typical chlorine odor one expects of a public pool - cigarette burn marks are on the furniture, alhtough I think we had a non-smoking room - the room was poorly stocked with necessitities (towels, shampoo, etc.); enough for 1-2 people, but we were 3. staff generally friendly, but incompetent - spa reservations were not difficult, yet messed up (specifically, we asked for a 1-hour massage...that somehow turned into a 30-min mud bath reservation) - bill handling at checkout was unprofessional, very very slow, and left us with a strong urge to check our credit-card statement Location - not in easy walking distance to the Lincoln Ave restaurants and stores...15-20 min walking time in Calistoga heat. - relatively quiet, given that it is far away from the "action" Price - cheap, relative to the other Calistoga-area hotels...with good reason. If you are the type that doesn't need a spa session, never walks barefoot in hotel rooms, and pays in cash...this place may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Invasion of Privacy!! Left early and forfeited a night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I paid upfront for 2 days at this motel. For my first night there, I had reservations at an upscale restaurant on Lincoln Avenue. At the restaurant I was seated at the bar and had full view of the chefs. I saw a chef flip a whole fish, and instead of catching it in the pan, it went on the floor. He scooped it off the floor and put it on a plate. It was promptly served to a table with a rather large party. I was horrified. I said something to the chef, paid my bill, and left. About an hour later, a phone call was put through to the room. It was the chef and he threatened me. I immediately called the front desk and was extremely angry that a call was put through to my room. I realized that I had given my motel (Village Inn & Spa) to the restaurant while making reservations. I had no idea that the front desk of the motel would assist the chef in finding my room. I was by myself and was petrified. I threw (literally!) everything in my car and left immediately. The motel refused to refund my stay for the night even though they completely violated my privacy. I will NEVER stay there again. In any event, it was a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: asiangirl007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with the 2 other people who posted their bad reviews below me. I was part of the family reunion/birthday party group. In addition to their reservation problems and having 4 adults and one child squeeze into one room, here's my own experience: It was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at and definately the worst spa experience ever. First it's a "motel" and the rooms are old, mattresses saggy. I was supposed to have the "deluxe suite" with Queen bed, sitting area, and whirlpool jacuzzi tub. It was not a suite as everything was in one big room, including the jacuzzi. There was a spider in my bed. I was charged about $119 for first night and $169 for second night. Then I paid $125 for mud bath, mineral tub, and half hour massage. I was supposed to get a discount on spa services which I didn't get. There is only one mud tub shared by everyone, it isn't sanitized and they only have you read and sign a form that says you don't have any diseases! The massage was terrible and didn't do a thing for me. The complimentary continental breakfast was coffee and a individualy wrapped muffin. It is way overpriced for what you get and I would not recommend this place to anyone. I do want to say that the staff was nice and tried to be helpful, but they were all very young "college aged" and most likely not very experienced. The one nice perk they gave me was offerring me the "reduced" first night price for the "deluxe suite", thoughtful, but still way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff are not rude, but they are stupid. They cannot properly operate their computer and hence screw-up both reservations and bills. I found the facilities to be poorly maintained and dirty. My family planned a reunion/birthday party four months in advance. We booked 4 rooms for two nights to accommodate the grandparents, children and grandchildren. Calistoga saw fit to cancel two of the bookings after one night because they needed the room, forcing us into a shared room. I only wish I had looked here *before* staying. Do yourself a favor and DON'T stay at the calistoga "spa". It's too bad the ratings are from 1-5 stars because they deserve a zero.

Reviews.Title: “Crummy motel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They turned our family reunion into unpleasant weekend. We placed three separate reservations for 2 nights (4 rooms). Somehow they ALL turned into reservations for 1 night. The staff disavowed any responsibility for the error. We did them a favor by squeezing into 3 rooms. They didn't offer so much as a discount for our trouble. My sister-in-law went to tell the staff that her toilet was not flushing. They handed her a plunger!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go”
Reviews.Author: michelle1234
Reviews.Content: The desk staff and the manager are rude. The desk staff doesn't know what they are doing about charges. The whole deal with paying separately and getting slips for the spa is not explained to you until you show up for the spa treatments and spend the next 10-15 minutes running around - back to your room to get a credit card, stand in line to pay, etc etc. What really burns me is when you complain to the manager and it turns out they are the problem. I'm burned up enough that I would like to look up who the real owners of this place are and complain to them. I am having a problem with my credit card charges. No "I'm sorry" or anythingl Just fax it in and we'll get back to you. When? Avoid this place- you won't relax here, you'll just get more stressed out.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went away for a romantic weekend with my partner and the room we stayed in had dirty sheets and no heat. The next day when I approached the hotel manager about this, she was so rude and upsetting to me I checked out at once. I have filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau, but they have not answered my complaint yet. In short, take your business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “nice room”
Reviews.Author: robiii
Reviews.Content: I thought the room was nice, large clean. The roman tub was very cool! My first mud bath I found over rated and pricey, but had to try it once. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and I liked the town.

Reviews.Title: “OH NO!!! there's a guy cleaning as you recieve your service!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I had frequented this establishment three times prior to this last visit and I had never seen male attendants cleaning while I received service. So while receiving a sea salt scrub (which is the only thing going for this place) I lifted my head and there to my amazement the male attendant is cleaning the mud area and watering the floor. When I asked why was he in this area while I'm receiving service I was told it's okay he's not looking. I felt totally disregarded and disrespected while my sisters had no problem with this I feel the need to let everyone know that if you feel uncomfortable with male attendants cleaning while receiving service this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay. The room was clean and quiet, the location was good, and the price was right. We found the staff to be efficient and courteous, and quite helpful, giving us coupons for dinner and winery tours, and answering all our questions. Two evenings we took wine and deli food from the Palisades Market and had a picnic on the deck near the pool. The gardens were attractive, and the mood very laid back. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice with kids - and the price is right.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: True, the Calistoga Village Inn and Spa isn't a luxury choice. The walls are thin. The carpets are questionable. But the price is right and it has a pool, so when you're traveling with kids, it's a decent choice. After a long, hot drive, it's nice to let the kids blow off steam in the pool (as opposed to in your room.) If it's just the two of you, upgrade and go somewhere else. If you have the kids along, the Calistoga Village Inn and Spa is fine.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was horrified when I checked in to this room. It smelt horrible, moldy and old. There was a two inch gap by the door so every night I had put a towel by the door to ensure things didn't crawl in. The walls were paper thin we were woken up at night when the neighbors came home. This place needs major renovation and updating. We gave notice, stayed two nights and moved across to the Comfort it. The comfort inn was friendly and the rooms were much better.
